paragraphs.text: So I’ve been asking myself lately: how can we create environments that are safe enough to make continuous improvement possible? How can we make a simple visualization of work less threatening. Thoughts? Please reply in the comments
paragraphs.name: 1da6
1da6
paragraphs.text: So I’ve been asking myself lately: how can we create environments that are safe enough to make continuous improvement possible? How can we make a simple visualization of work less threatening. Thoughts? Please reply in the comments

paragraphs.name: a1c3
paragraphs.text: Shining the mirror back on an organization is painful. It very quickly exposes all sorts of human issues. It is these human issues that typically block change.

3aa0df0359f7.title: A comment like “Kanban didn’t change anything” suggests tool-focused thinking about organizational…

paragraphs.text: A comment like “Kanban didn’t change anything” suggests tool-focused thinking about organizational change. Involvement of leadership and buy-in to an improvement process based on what they see in the visualizations would be part of triggering real change, and often this part of the process is bypassed, in the hopes that just seeing the information…
paragraphs.name: 1fff

virtuals.subtitle: This is often difficult for insiders to do, because of system dynamics based on where the IT organization sits in the organization, and is…

content.subtitle: This is often difficult for insiders to do, because of system dynamics based on where the IT organization sits in the organization, and is…

a920fc63982a.title: I applaud Joshua Kerievsky and his work with Anzeneering, and regard safety as useful, beneficial…

paragraphs.text: I applaud Joshua Kerievsky and his work with Anzeneering, and regard safety as useful, beneficial and even necessary. But I don’t see safety at the only prerequisite for effective continuous improvement and change.
paragraphs.name: cb5d

paragraphs.text: I concur that the absence of visualisation in many organisations is a signifier. I choose to see it as a sign…

e7ddf0aa6e84.title: John, great question — and as others noted, the question at the end has nothing to do with Kanban.

paragraphs.text: John, great question — and as others noted, the question at the end has nothing to do with Kanban. To bring change to a group of people who suffer from toxic inertia is a hard problem. I believe that several published books discuss these issues and possible solutions.

virtuals.subtitle: Have you met great managers who energize their teams and make the impossible happen? Would you say that the companies where these managers…

content.subtitle: Have you met great managers who energize their teams and make the impossible happen? Would you say that the companies where these managers…

a33e3feb0d51.title: I’m a continuous improvement coach and I don’t think people resent the visualization stuff on…

paragraphs.text: I’m a continuous improvement coach and I don’t think people resent the visualization stuff on itself. They resent it as extra work only if it doesn’t lead to improvement. Which, sadly, is often the case.
paragraphs.name: af0f

paragraphs.text: As you said, people know they’re overworked. But showing how much, where and how should help management define priorities…

virtuals.subtitle: As you said, people know they’re overworked. But showing how much, where and how should help management define priorities between that…

content.subtitle: As you said, people know they’re overworked. But showing how much, where and how should help management define priorities between that…

e81dbaffa8f6.title: The question is: Why is visualization of work threatening?

paragraphs.text: The question is: Why is visualization of work threatening? And threatening who? After all the problems and inneficiencies exists… visible or not and being invisible is the real threath.
paragraphs.name: eaa5

4e8405a739cc.title: The most important thing we need to achieve is to overcome Dunning-Kruger club.

paragraphs.text: The most important thing we need to achieve is to overcome Dunning-Kruger club. Actually it is funny how this reverse strikes here — I see that as an indication for how ridicoulus this effect is.
paragraphs.name: a801

paragraphs.text: Because I think it will not be possible to make work visible with everyone feeling comfortable whilst people do not trust each…

paragraphs.text: Wow excellent topic and commentary! I agree a key issue is the in your face view of organizational dysfunction. But I think a huge issue Kanban gets blamed for is where to start with a complex system. Most people continue to make patterns out of the work and then categorize the patterns. This is natural and can be good until it turns into admiration…
paragraphs.name: f2ef

c8b3b0e6191.title: No one here seems to have mentioned the most obvious flaw of Kanban: that it relies on units of…

paragraphs.text: No one here seems to have mentioned the most obvious flaw of Kanban: that it relies on units of work following the same set of phases in the same order. (Well, more or less.)
paragraphs.name: 159a

paragraphs.text: Kanban started in factories, a fact reflected in its uncompromising structure. It’s a linear process from A to B to C. This happens to work well for…
paragraphs.name: ecfa

virtuals.subtitle: Kanban started in factories, a fact reflected in its uncompromising structure. It’s a linear process from A to B to C. This happens to work…

content.subtitle: Kanban started in factories, a fact reflected in its uncompromising structure. It’s a linear process from A to B to C. This happens to work…

paragraphs.text: Or a bad process.
paragraphs.name: 8a15

9ed010a64764.title: The culture that uses it, of course.

paragraphs.text: The culture that uses it, of course. So we need to figure out how to make something so simple less threatening.
paragraphs.name: b925

bd0bbdf6e4df.title: I’m not familiar with Kanban, but I’m familiar with failed organisational change; and some…

paragraphs.text: I’m not familiar with Kanban, but I’m familiar with failed organisational change; and some, although fewer, successful organisational change efforts. In my exp tools can be used to open dialogue, and that it’s dialogue that creates change not tools/instruments — unless you have the view that the consultant/change agent is the instrument of change…
paragraphs.name: 733c

8ab6c9876d5c.title: I think one of the best systems to visualize project state is fewer chart from Critical Chain PM.

paragraphs.text: I think one of the best systems to visualize project state is fewer chart from Critical Chain PM.
paragraphs.name: 4fda

727f5f4df95.title: You are raising such important questions here.

paragraphs.text: You are raising such important questions here. One keyword from your article that really stands out is the word “trigger”. When you visualize work or even visualize a board of who is on what team people can get uncomfortable and feel threatened. I remember when we made a board which exposed systemic issues way above the team level. Management got…

3a015e7e5335.title: I don’t think you can make the visualization less threatening.

paragraphs.text: I don’t think you can make the visualization less threatening. If you did, you would reduce it’s effectiveness. Kanban is cool because it can be used to expose the truth in a simple way.
paragraphs.name: 77f3

paragraphs.text: Create an environment of continuous improvement? An environment of transparency? That has to start at the top.
paragraphs.name: bcc2

virtuals.subtitle: Create an environment of continuous improvement? An environment of transparency? That has to start at the top.

content.subtitle: Create an environment of continuous improvement? An environment of transparency? That has to start at the top.

paragraphs.text: Start with smaller, non-controversial problems? Visualising the larger context is itself an intervention that will likely be controversial if no pre-existing trust has been established.
paragraphs.name: e519

paragraphs.text: Hi John, Is XDCPM applicable? In it’s simplest form, XDCPM expresses any project management network as a table of paths, with highest priority paths to the left. Each color and priority is clearly established, so that if two people seek the same resource, it’s clear which has priority.
paragraphs.name: cbe1

virtuals.subtitle: Essentially, XDCPM takes the human interpretation part out of the post-it style Kanban/project-management board.

content.subtitle: Essentially, XDCPM takes the human interpretation part out of the post-it style Kanban/project-management board.

7b8800e0d846.title: Absolutely not the intent. Good catch Dave

paragraphs.text: Absolutely not the intent. Good catch Dave
paragraphs.name: 7ffa

8a4fff42712a.title: All these problems are people and culture related.

paragraphs.text: All these problems are people and culture related. Kanban or any other form of visualization are tools that can help with the improvement and enable reflection and wouldn’t work without the culture being in place.
paragraphs.name: 5ff2

paragraphs.text: An organisation needs the will to change and senior management buy in is very important.
paragraphs.name: 2a09

virtuals.subtitle: An organisation needs the will to change and senior management buy in is very important.

content.subtitle: An organisation needs the will to change and senior management buy in is very important.

c93bc59627a5.title: One common cause I’ve seen is is fatalism, in the form of victim’s syndrome within the delivery…

paragraphs.text: One common cause I’ve seen is is fatalism, in the form of victim’s syndrome within the delivery group, including delivery group leadership. If the participants have been mired in the system of their current organization for so long that they see no hope of change, visualizing the list seems only to be a path to more personal pain. If asking business…
paragraphs.name: df93

virtuals.subtitle: Sometimes a try for upwards empathy works, from the perspective that “if leadership doesn’t on a gut level understand how the whole picture…

content.subtitle: Sometimes a try for upwards empathy works, from the perspective that “if leadership doesn’t on a gut level understand how the whole picture…

e5e1ef1845fa.title: Kanban has some drawbacks that make it difficult or less desirable to work with.

paragraphs.text: Kanban has some drawbacks that make it difficult or less desirable to work with.

paragraphs.text: Visual part is a good thing but being able to visualize all moving parts of a project actually means not representing the details of individual work tracks. Otherwise we will end up cluttering the Kanban board/chart. I feel Kanban works for Epic…

paragraphs.text: “I Hate Kanban…”
paragraphs.name: 6d95

paragraphs.text: Wandering the conference halls I overhear…
paragraphs.name: cb45

paragraphs.text: Yeah. Kanban sucks. I hate it! Didn’t change anything …
paragraphs.name: 260c

paragraphs.text: Forget for a moment that you can model anything with Kanban (it is “way” agnostic)…
paragraphs.name: 39c5

virtuals.subtitle: Wandering the conference halls I overhear…

content.subtitle: Wandering the conference halls I overhear…

paragraphs.text: It is surprisingly flexible. For example, you don’t need to dig down to the nitty gritty details. “In Progress” will suffice. Or remove the columns altogether and use other information radiators. Whatever it takes to make work visible.
paragraphs.name: d021

96a8bccccd02.title: For me this points out how the process doesn’t fix problems it exposes them.

paragraphs.text: For me this points out how the process doesn’t fix problems it exposes them. I have seen way too often that the process is changed to try to fix a problem but the problem isn’t addressed. For instance switching from Scrum to Kanban to make it easier to inject production bugs instead of addressing why there are production bugs or the priority they are given.
paragraphs.name: a728

f3d8e9306bbf.title: John, I like the article but please don’t refer to people as “resources”.

paragraphs.text: John, I like the article but please don’t refer to people as “resources”. It’s dehumanizing at best, and perpetuates the thoroughly debunked notion that people are replaceable cogs in a wheel.
paragraphs.name: 298a

3f2be097a39a.title: You really think this is the KanBan board’s fault or the culture that uses it?

paragraphs.text: You really think this is the KanBan board’s fault or the culture that uses it?
paragraphs.name: fb7b

7b7caa77d34c.title: You can roll a turd in glitter and it still is a turd.

paragraphs.text: You can roll a turd in glitter and it still is a turd. To be a bit more serious, I think that a common organisational goal is a “trigger” that helps disarm the threat you are writing about.
paragraphs.name: 6ddd
